result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry H Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Straight time.  Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with the Piggly Wiggly listed in the complaint.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions.  To commence Tuesday, October 18, 2016 by 6:00p.m.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

From Clerk to defendant, request needs to be submitted to jail records.

From defendant received 12/1/17 requesting document stating release date.
  **Reviewed by Judge Michael J. Aprahamian on 12/4/17; If jail is calculating release date, they can provide with documentation.**

records.addlTxt:
From Sheriff dated 10/19/16 re defendant's failure to report for Huber. Attached email providing he reported the following evening.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian 10/25/16.
Branch 9 only.

Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court.   Defendant Larry H Johnson did not appear.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements regarding the nonappearance of the defendant.  She spoke with him this morning, but is not getting an answer at this time.  Court issues a capias, branch 9 only.  Defendant appeared late.  Case recalled at 3:26 pm.  State appeared by Kevin Osborne.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Rumpf.  Court quashes the capias.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following to count #1:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

9 months straight time.  (Credit - 1 day).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Piggly Wiggly listed in complaing.

Perform  20 hours of community service each year of probation;

Condition Time: 15 days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence Tuesday 10/18/2016 by 6:00 pm.  

COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Sentencing hearing on October 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Larry H Johnson in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Rumpf requests an adjournment for the reasons stated on the record.   The State does not object to the adjournment request.  The Court grants the request and reschedules the case for plea and sentencing in one week.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. With Attached witness list.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Larry H Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court strikes the repeater and finds defendant guilty.  The Court schedules the matter for sentencing in about 60 days and bail remains as set.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Rumpf requests an adjournment due to medical reasons for her client.  The Court schedules the matter for trial.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:15 am.
